trial_identification.studytitle: Comparison of 3 dimensional echocardiographys accuracy to cardiac MRI scans.
trial_identification.scientifictitle: Comparison of left and right ventricular volume measurements with Real-time 3-dimensional echocardiography and cardiac magnetic resonance imaging in congenital heart disease

conditions.healthcondition: Congenital heart disease, subjects with a cardiac defect that they have been born with.

interventions.interventions: Real time 3 dimensional echo (RT3DE) data to be collected from subjects with congenital heart disease for measurement of Right ventricle (RV)/ Left ventricle (LV) parameters and compared with cardiac magnetic resonance imaging (MRI) data of the same parameters. This would take 1 year.

primaryOutcome.outcome: Bland Altman analysis of comparitive data for both LV and RV real time 3 dimensional echocardiography datasets vs cardiac MRI.
primaryOutcome.timepoint: Dataset will be collected at the time of their cardiac MRI and compared. No other timepoints for remeasuring.

secondaryOutcome.outcome: Bland altman analysis of semi automated border detection technology for RT3DE in congenital heart disease vs cardiac MRI.
secondaryOutcome.timepoint: Datasets analysed will be the same as those collected at the time of their cardiac MRI. No other time points for remeasuring.

eligibility.inclusivecriteria: Patient population are patients on waiting list for cardiac MRI for congenital heart defect and NOT requiring general anaesthesia.Inclusion criteria:1) have congenital heart disease2) patient not require general anaesthesia for scan.
eligibility.exclusivecriteria: 1) significant alteration of clinical status (alteration in preload or afterload conditions) between MRI and RT3DE scan. ie received IV fluids, taken diuretics2)Both scan must occur within 3 hours of each other.

sponsorship.primarysponsorname: Paediatric Congenital Cardiac Services (PCCS), Starship hospital

ethicsAndSummary.summary: Study will use real time 3 dimensional echocardiography (RT3DE) to determine right and left ventricular volumes, ejection fraction (EF) and mass on patients with congenital heart disease under going cardiac MRI. This is a validation study of RT3DE, a new modality of cardiac imaging for clinical use in congenital heart disease.
